website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic option for choosy parakeets who love fruit more than anything, and you’ll feel good knowing their fruity diet contains the essential nutrients needed for an all-around healthy diet.
pros: Corn, soybeans, and wheat are the first 3 ingredients
Features large amounts of real grapes, bananas, oranges, and apples
Small pellets are easy for parakeets to easily ingest
cons: With as much real fruit that is included in these pellets, it’s a shame they added so much artificial color

customer_reviews.title: Better than the variety with the tiny bananas.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our two parakeets, who hate us. I was feeding them the Zupreem food with the bananas, but they threw the bananas out of their cage, so the floor of the room where they live was constantly littered with tiny bananas. So far, they seem to like this food better, and I haven't noticed any of the little balls being tossed out, so hopefully they do like it better. They don't like *us* better, but at least they're enjoying their food more.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Baroncini-Moe

customer_reviews.title: This batch has mealy worms
customer_reviews.text: I buy this in the pet store so I decided to have amazon ship this to me out of convenience. My bag had little mealy worms in them, both larvae and worms.They look like what you get in flour, the expiration date is still good but there's now worms everywhere in my food container. I'm hoping by freezing it will help with being live bugs in it.
customer_reviews.author: lajandt

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but the birds enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: This brand of food is so darn expensive, but these pellets are the only ones my feather babies will eat. They always arrive fresh and one bag lasts a long time since I alternate with other foods. Sadly this is cheaper on Amazon than it is through my local pet store :( I would recommend buying this product if your birds are picky like mine.
customer_reviews.author: RiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: PARAKEETS HAVE A HARD TIME EATING IT
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked the zupreem brand of bird foods. This product is no exeption. The only reason i give it 4 stars is that I actually think the size of the pieces are too big for my keets. They like it and I do see them trying to eat it, i think either they are too big or too hard for their little beaks. I don't know the exact reason. They are in perfect health, so it is not a soft beak issue. If i could make a suggestion to the zupreem family is maybe make a softer or smaller pellet for these little guys.
customer_reviews.author: LittlePaws

customer_reviews.title: Foul smell
customer_reviews.text: I have 11 budgies, and I’ve successfully managed to convert all of them to pellets except one. I thought maybe if I tried a different brand she’d be willing to give the pellets a try, so I ordered these. Normally my birds eat the Roudybush crumbles. As soon as I opened the bag, I noticed it had a foul smell, but I thought maybe that was normal and the birds wouldn’t mind it. After 3 days of trying, none of my birds would go near it. Now I’m thinking this bag must not be fresh, hence the smell, and that must be why they won’t even try it.
customer_reviews.author: kathy077

customer_reviews.title: My 4 Budgies & 4 Cockatiels Approve! (Small sized pellets)
customer_reviews.text: This food is amazing. All of my birds (4 budgies & 4 cockatiels) were fed a seed diet previously. I tried roudybush, Tops, and Harrisons pellets without any luck. (Those are all pretty pricey too) From day one my birds all ate this Zupreem Fruit Blend. I never had to do any transitioning, I literally just filled their dishes with the food and they ate every last bit of it. I definitely reccomend the small sized food for cockatiels. Mine seem to like the smaller bits better and it is easier for them to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Our Keets love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Our parakeets love this stuff. The veterinarian says that we should switch exclusively to this and not bother with seeds, and, according to him, this product has all of the necessary nutrients and other ingredients for healthy birds. One distinct advantage to this product is that you don't have to blow out any chaffe as compared to seed. At the same time, parakeets still throw this stuff around just as they do with seed, so the cage bottom becomes multi-colored, and since we still use seed as well, we see the brown seeds but mixed with the multi-colored nuggets on the floor of the cage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food for birds that wont eat seeds
customer_reviews.text: My burd does not eat seeds, eat fruits, meet, bread etc. Raised it with cat food but eats this fruit pellets, keeps my bird in great shape, no need for cat food anymore. I have been using them for a bit over a year, no problems at all. I also mix a few drops of a vitamin from anazon for the bird plumage, great results
customer_reviews.author: REDBOX MASTER

customer_reviews.title: No mess
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been purchasing the ZuPreem Fruitblend pellets for approximately 6 years. We’ve had our parakeets for a little over seven years, tried different food in the beginning. All the food that we tried prior to the ZuPreem was thrown all over the place along with the discarded shells. The ZuPreem has no shell and our birds love it
customer_reviews.author: ricknjill

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this for my two parakeets thinking it would be ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my two parakeets thinking it would be a treat for them, one is three years olf the other is two. They refuse to eat it, its been weeks and they just don't go near it. Just me expericence, I guess it worked our differently for others,
customer_reviews.author: Birdseye101

customer_reviews.title: My birds love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 birds and I actually put a little of this in their food to get a taste. I have 2 crimson belly conures and one got its beak bitten off by its mate so I had to find a way to feed the other one with no beak. I was giving him baby bird food but I didn't feel it was best because he is an adult. I give him veggies daily and I mix these pellets with water and they soften up so that my bird can eat, he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: Made seed to pellet transfer a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended this food to get my budgies off of the seed diet they were started on in the pet store. It worked. They are now eating this as their main food source. The only thing they won’t eat is the yellow pellets.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it - but this particular bag smelled off
customer_reviews.text: My birds will eat them, which is a major compliment. :) They've been on this pellet for about a year, and this (among other healthier diet choices) has helped clear up one of my parakeets' liver disease. They're fit, healthy, and happy. However, I rated the freshness a bit lower because the bag of this product I received smelled slightly off to me.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Tiel' loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel took to this food immediately. He did not like the naturals version that zupreme makes. The actual cockatiel size pellets were too big for his liking. The parakeet size is perfect! There is still a lot of crumb waste but it can't be helped. At least he's on something better then straight seed. 4 instead of 5 stars because of the artificial colors used. There's other options out there that would be much healthier for coloring the food! Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Jos88

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a parrotlet (I give this to my 2 month parrotlet). After a few tries during the week, he eventually came around to eating pellets on his own. They are very fruity smelling (almost like fruity pebbles). I made sure to eat dinner near him while ZuPreem pellets were near my parrotlet, purposibly making a big deal anytime he tried one. Personally, I like to give my parrotlet a mixture of diet (pellets, mash of veggies, grains, seeds, etc). These are a great addition to his overall diet.
customer_reviews.author: nightwish224

customer_reviews.title: Healthy birds
customer_reviews.text: I feed this to my two English budgies (mix fruit blend, regular and Nutriberry seeds in a 1:2:1 mix) I don't think it is the flavor they like, it is the color. One bird likes the orange on some days, then some days he eats all the green first. By the end of the day, everything is gone. I mix it with the other because I'd really rather not give them dyed food.
customer_reviews.author: Binks

customer_reviews.title: no seeds!
customer_reviews.text: My parakeets did not believe this was food at first. I've been trying to slowly switch them from seeds to pellets with a blend of both, but they were throwing the pellets out or ignoring them. They looked so betrayed when I put this in their bowl! They figured it out after a little while, though. It does smell fruity which I'm hoping will encourage them as I'm going to start trying to give them fresh fruit and veggie treats again (they were confused and honestly scared by them previously).
customer_reviews.author: Christina Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: My bird did not like them
customer_reviews.text: My Parakeet did not like this product. I must admit when I opened the bag the sweet smell of the product was hard to take. Maybe because I’m not a real sweets person. Either way when I included them in her food she would eat everything else but them
customer_reviews.author: Rides1bigbroom

customer_reviews.title: Broken package, possibly contaminated.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parakeets and I received the the bag broken, the food had spilled in the box and the box was barely holding up. UPS asked me if I wanted to send it back but I figured it was ok. Well, a little over two weeks later two of my parakeets have died. I believe this food was contaminated. I have tried reporting the damaged box when I received it but it just said “no returns.” I would like a refund considering how I received the product, two of my birds have died and I threw out the food. Something was definitely wrong with this food.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate description & can't return
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 LB "Small" for my canaries, but the item I received is "Medium" to "Big" and is not for canaries. It has parakeets image on it. Did not do anything with the package, came to Amazon in order to return it and then page said "This item is not eligible for returns". Now item will just sit here.
customer_reviews.author: Khalil K.

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: My GCC came on this food and after reading about artificial dyes not being the best I returned.
customer_reviews.author: amberpom

customer_reviews.title: Good use by date
customer_reviews.text: Glad to see that it has a July 2021 expiration date. I was worried that ordering over the internet might result in a batch that wasn't exactly fresh. Once I purchased one at a local store and after a while, noticed it had a stale odor. You can tell when it has a good fruit odor.
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Happy pair of parakeets.
customer_reviews.text: My two parakeets get so excited whenever it's mealtime; they adore this food. That's more than can be said for the brand that they were being fed previously, since they would literally throw certain bits of food out of their dish, or outright not eat it. I dare say they like this almost as well as they do millet sprays! ...Almost. I also like that they're getting what nutrients they need. Extremely important for delicate animals like budgies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made the switch from seed mixes
customer_reviews.text: My parrotlet really likes the fruit flavor 😋 made the switch from regular seed mixes to pellets at Veterinary recommendation due to my little guy being overweight and beak growing quickly. He's doing well on the pellets :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: My lovebird loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My lovebird loves this stuff! Although I've noticed she maybe a little OCB - she eats them by color leaving the red ones for last. Crazy sweet bird. She looks wonderful and healthy! Plus less mess!
customer_reviews.author: Y.Quinn

customer_reviews.title: I got these for my cockatiel after trying to larger ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my cockatiel after trying to larger size because he was only eating half of each pellet and the other pieces would go flying across the entire room, what a mess! This is a lot easier for him and me. Still kicks up crumbs but there's a lot less. Noticed his feathers are much shinier now and he truly enjoys eating these!
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: My birds love these! They’re the only pellets they will eat ...
customer_reviews.text: My birds love these! They’re the only pellets they will eat without throwing a fit. The only thing I dislike is that they are rather expensive and highly wasteful. They pop everywhere when my birds nom on them, meaning more if it ends up in the floor and counter than in their bellies! I bought this size for my cockatiels and parakeets but I think I might have to get the smaller ones to prevent the mess. Great product otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: RiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: but then his mood started to get worse and worse every day
customer_reviews.text: My parakeet ate this, but then his mood started to get worse and worse every day. he became lethargic and grumpy and wouldn't sing as much. I switched his food back to his original more natural food and his mood improved very quickly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Nutritional Cadillac of bird food
customer_reviews.text: I've depended on Zupreem Fruitblend for all of the different types of birds that I've ever cared for. Birds love it. Nutritionally complete. I've fed it exclusively to my birds without supplements of any kind for over ten years and I've never had a nutrition or digestive problem. Costs more. Totally worth every penny. Just feed & forget. The Cadillac of bird food.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: BETTER SIZE FOR OUR COCKATIEL
customer_reviews.text: I order this size for our cockatiel since he has trouble actually eating the one meant for a cockatiel. He prefers the smaller size. We have zero waste with this size. I mix this food with Harrison's High Potency Fine which is a much better quality so our bird can have variety. The Harrison food is a plain color and this stuff adds a bit more interest with the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Girl

customer_reviews.title: I buy the Zupreem Small Keet food for my cockatiel ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy the Zupreem Small Keet food for my cockatiel. The larger pellets, the ones designated for cockatiels, break into more pieces and their projectiles scatter farther. My bird loves this food and has no problem with the different colors. It doesn't give him rainbow poop or anything crazy. But it does have a lovely, fruity smell. He might not notice it, but I do. It's the little things in life...
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a hole in the bag and food all over the box
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived with a hole in the bag and bird food all over in the box! Not happy with this at all! I’ve been feeding my birds this food for over 12 years and these bags are really sturdy, I have no idea how one of them would get a hole when they normally require scissors just to open the bag.
customer_reviews.author: R Bibbs

customer_reviews.title: 4 picky birds will eat this
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 birds and only one isn't a picky eater. This is the only product they will eat that isn't 90% seed. It's healthier and more cost effective than the seed heavy foods. Also nice is ther isn't a seed mess as it's shelled.
customer_reviews.author: Wdryden

customer_reviews.title: Good sized pellets for small parrots
customer_reviews.text: Good sized pellets for little hook bills. Less mess and the birds seem to enjoy the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Collector

customer_reviews.title: Best food
customer_reviews.text: Birds really like this food and no food is thrown about. They it to the dust in the bottom of the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Raven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Zupreem has been around for quite awhile and I finally decided to give it a try for my two cockatiels and one budgie. I ordered the 10lb parakeet size food and feed it to all my birds and as soon as they got it they all started to eat right away! I mix this food along with Roudybush daily maintenance mini pellets and they look excellent! Each brand meets all the nutritional requirements for my birds. I do not recommend feeding an all seed diet. Seed diets are not nutritionally complete on their own and should only be given as a treat. If you own cockatiels check out cockatielcottage.com
customer_reviews.author: mmc

customer_reviews.title: Good for my cockatiels, not a lot of spillage
customer_reviews.text: The medium bird foods is too big for cockatiels, bits of food keeps flying out of the cage so I got the smaller ones for them and there are a lot less spillage now. Also cheaper too!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: (she's 14 now) This is not a good staple diet
customer_reviews.text: My Green-Cheek Conure loves this stuff. She has, ever since she was a little baby bird. (she's 14 now) This is not a good staple diet, there's not enough nutrition in it as a staple diet, too much sugar in it..... but it's an excellent treat! It is fruit flavored- and my bird calls it "JUICE" :-) ...so she gives it 5-stars too. With a mixed diet of fresh foods, juices, meats, seeds, fresh fruits and such, your bird will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman

customer_reviews.title: but I’m happy since they are getting some vitamins and proper nutrition ...
customer_reviews.text: My Quaker parrot and green cheek prefer to eat these pellets... my Lovebird won’t touch it and will throw it at me or out of her cage! My cockatiel will eat it sometimes.. but I’m happy since they are getting some vitamins and proper nutrition eating these. If your bird doesn’t like them, it’s easy to find rainbow colored pellets on the floor to vacuum up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fruity Pebbles
customer_reviews.text: My parakeets love this. I'm not crazy about the wild colors just because I don't think adding flourescent colors to the bird food is healthy for the bird but my keets adore this food. (you wouldn't know that by the amount of bird food they fling on the floor). But it does provide a healthy and balanced diet and my keets are bright and happy. The pellets are small enough for them to eat and they even scoop out the little crumbs and eat those as well. I do have to add that their poop is rather colorful after eating this food too. So don't be surprised to see strange colored bird droppings.
customer_reviews.author: Xenomorphs

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Always buy this brand of bird pellets but I was a dummy buying them at a pet store where one bag cost the same there as 2 bags from Amazon. Exatly the same product, brand, and size.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: These have a nice fruity scent and are supposed to be much better ...
customer_reviews.text: After a long 2 months or so, my parakeet has finally converted over to these pellets. These have a nice fruity scent and are supposed to be much better nutritionally for birds than fatty seeds. We also supplement our bird's diet with fresh fruits and veggies, along with an occasional Fun Yun. :
customer_reviews.author: Good Bird

customer_reviews.title: Good budgie food
customer_reviews.text: My budgies are healthier since being put on this food. We had obesity issues on plain seed, fruit and veggies. Not the case with primarily feeding this and then supplementing with the seed, fruits and veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Emily McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Chip loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this feed for my cockatiel Chip he's 2 months old and he absolutely loves this food. First day the food came in I put some in his bowl and he has been hooked since. Also after starting this new food i see that his poop has definitely changed in size and texture so he's for sure eating alot of food between the seeds and this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: T-mart

customer_reviews.title: Supreme bird food
customer_reviews.text: Zupreem is a supreme product, my birds love it, this is only a three star rating because I received the wrong bird food, I got the medium bird food instead of the small. Fortunately, I have three different birds and could use it for one of the others. I had to reorder the right size for my parrotlet.
customer_reviews.author: Debora Bogart

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to last a while! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money! This bag is huge and it arrived super fast! The birds are already excited once they caught a glimpse of the bag! As for the flavor, while my parakeets seem to prefer fresh fruit over pellets, they still prefer these over the "natural" zupreem blend.
customer_reviews.author: Ellitchhizui

customer_reviews.title: A Favorite for Our Birds
customer_reviews.text: We have 7 birds in our household and they all love Zupreem pellets. Doves and parakeets alike, they all enjoy this food. We feed this in combination with a small amount of seed and our birds are very happy and healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Fun treat to add fruit to birds diet
customer_reviews.text: Fun addition to my birds diet. Gives variety and I haven't tasted it but you can smell the different fruit flavors. I mix it with a pellet food I have fed my bird instead of seeds
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K McNeill

customer_reviews.title: Great for a lovebird.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I first got my lovebird at 8 weeks . He ate it just fine. I bought another brand from a local retail store. I noticed my bird was pooping a lot and had ruffled feathers. I finally switched back to this food and he has been doing fine. I will only by this from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon C

customer_reviews.title: Best food, great for plumage!
customer_reviews.text: This food helped my birds plumage get brighter and gives them energy. Priced but worth it. Birds have to have nutrition they need or they get feet problems and eye disorders.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Keet Food, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I feed this ZuPreem Keet food to my colony of lutino Bourke's, and they do extremely well on it and produce lots of babies. The seller offered a great price ans shipped quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tau Ceti Four

customer_reviews.title: Pellets were to small
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting bigger pellets. These are two small and my bird doesn’t eat them. Nothing against the pellets themselves I think if I had a smaller bird like a parakeet these would be perfect. Next time I need to pay closer attention before I order.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Great deal !!
customer_reviews.text: Great package deal in my local pet store I almost pay this same price for just one 2 pound bag and I tell you getting two of them for this price is well worth it
customer_reviews.author: SpitFireKat

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your birds
customer_reviews.text: My picky cockatiels will ignore these pellets. Mixing some in their seed bowl (trying to get them to eat healthier) but they take them out. On occasion I've seen them nibble on a piece but that's it. I tried giving them to the outside birds (house sparrows) but even they ignore it lol. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: My Budgies Don't Like Fruit
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because this is an expensive product that states that it it for Budgies. Mine refuse to eat any of it.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: HELPS THE BIRD POOP
customer_reviews.text: SHE EATS THIS AND HER POOP IS RAINBOWS, A+++++ LOVE THE BIRD POOP EVERYWHERE FINALLY BEING NICE COLORS STILL SMELLS BAD BUT HEY IT'S LIKE LISA FRANK EXPLODED IN THE BIRD CAGE
customer_reviews.author: SHAWNANANANANANANANANANNEEENEEE

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME NUTRITIONAL BIRD FOOD FROM A VERY TRUSTED COMPANY
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product & Zupreem is a great company. I have been feeding this food to my Starling for almost 12yrs now. He loves it & he is healthy. The ZuPreem customer service I must add, is phenomenal too, any questions they will help you out and they DO return phone calls. Nice in this day & age with businesses. GREAT FOOD FOR MY BIRD! Thanks ZuPreem!
customer_reviews.author: GearedUp

customer_reviews.title: ZUPREME provides nutrition for a variety of birds.
customer_reviews.text: I "met" the ZUPREME brand when I started a wildlife rehabilitation program back in "79" that still exists in 2015. Injured or orphaned small birds do well on their diet. So, when I discovered the brand on Amazon, I have bought several kinds for my parakeet, and 2 Myers Parrots. Oddly, the Myers seem to like the parakeet size pellets better than the cockatiel size. Well, I now have plenty of several kinds to mix and match for our 3 birds.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Good for picky birds
customer_reviews.text: I have two finicky eater birds (a budgie and a tiel) and they both chow on this stuff. They eat the fruit blend pellets and veggies I give them and they thrive. Delivery and packaging were great. Heads up; The food bags themselves are resealable so don't cut too much off from the top!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: My parrotlets love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have several parrotlets and they all love these pellets. I give them a lot of other various foods in addition, so this is not their only available food, but they love these. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J K

customer_reviews.title: Good for nutrition
customer_reviews.text: My bag came ripped. But otherwise the quality was good. My birds love these (as long as they are used to pellets).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Product itself is fine, packaging issue
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from my photo, the bag was open upon arrival. It wasn't ripped so I don't suspect foul play. The bag has unstuck from the ziploc, so it was more like bad manufacturing. This amount of food is supposed to last 3 months for our budgies, yet will not be sealable unless we pay for additional storage or (more likely) lose a cereal container.
customer_reviews.author: Fresh Family

customer_reviews.title: Fresh, tasty and a fun treat for Simon!
customer_reviews.text: This food is smaller than we normally feed to our Quaker parrot, but works *perfectly* in the little self-serve treat station we have hanging on his favorite hang-out balls since the food is a smaller size. Was fresh, smells great and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: RedRob

customer_reviews.title: Only one my bird eats
customer_reviews.text: I have to buy these in the small size for my green cheek conure. It's the only pellets it eats. He is healthy, and happy, and that makes this "parront" happy!
customer_reviews.author: MamaHen

customer_reviews.title: Parakeets love these tiny morsels
customer_reviews.text: My parakeets love this nutritious food. Since the pieces are tiny they actually make less mess and waste less food.
customer_reviews.author: pom love

customer_reviews.title: My bird didnt care for it
customer_reviews.text: Im not saying theres anything wrong with this bird feed,my parakeet just prefers "seed"!I mixed it with some seed in one dish and put just seed in another and he hasnt touched the feed one.
customer_reviews.author: doya wanna know

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 parakeets, and none of them would ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 parakeets, and none of them would even touch it. Tossed it in the woods out back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Van Jeune

customer_reviews.title: My birds loves this food!
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding this to my birds for years and they love the ZuPreem fruit blend. It's better for birds than a seed diet and my vet approves that this is my food of choice for them!
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: My birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: My pet quail love this feed. I know that they are getting the nutrition they need !
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mal

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Have been feeding this to my bird for 15 years he doesn't like it when I try to switch it up.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy K

customer_reviews.title: and she hated all of them
customer_reviews.text: Sora is so picky and was seed fed budgie. Tried three other varieties, and she hated all of them. She LOVES this one. I'm so happy we're on the right track. Thank you! Weirdly, she tends to prefer the red ones, so her droppings are pink.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Angel

customer_reviews.title: Parrotlet loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Parrotlet is fed a diet of Zupreem, seed and fresh food. Zupreem available at all times due to specie's rapid metabolism. She's always been healthy and even survived laying 13 unfertilized eggs over several months after reaching sexual maturity. Please don't buy, breed, or sell parrots. They are not pets. Re home and rescue the ones which cannot be released back to the wild. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Saavy Consumer

customer_reviews.title: My Cockatiel Ellie is Loving Her Pellets!
customer_reviews.text: I got these pellets for my cockatiel Ellie to ensure good health and nutrition and to stop her chronic egg laying. Ellie is loving her pellets. I highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Elliesmom

customer_reviews.title: My birds love it and it’s cheaper buy them here.
customer_reviews.text: My bird love this this food and for the price it makes it that much better. Nothing like waking up to see the bird cage covered in bright bird food every day.
customer_reviews.author: Guy who bought this.

customer_reviews.title: wasn't sure if my bird would like this and he does
customer_reviews.text: wasn't sure if my bird would like this and he does, which makes me very happy. I thought I would try something different from Zupreem, because my baby has been eating just the regular pellets from Zupreem Naturals, so I thought I would mix it up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: B Tomolovski

customer_reviews.title: Birds won’t eat this
customer_reviews.text: None of my birds will eat these no matter how many different ways I try.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: Got my birds back.
customer_reviews.text: I was using playing seed. And this help my birds get back on track. Thanks, Robyn
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Parrot candy?
customer_reviews.text: Delish! All parrots love this. Wish I had invented it.
customer_reviews.author: K Chung

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and they love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Quaker parrots as they like smaller pieces. It is a great diet and their main diet. My second Quaker that I got had some really rough looking tail feathers, since he started eating this after I got him (he was on seeds before) his tail feathers are really starting to grow out nice! They also love this food and eat it very very well. Switching my second Quaker to this from seed only took a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Jerica

customer_reviews.title: Happy ☺ birds 🐦
customer_reviews.text: I have two parakeets and wanted to try something new in their diet...it took them a while to get used to it because they are use to seed but eventually they started eating it and now they love 💘 it...I have 2 very happy and healthy birds.
customer_reviews.author: nitabk1

customer_reviews.title: They love them all
customer_reviews.text: I breed cockatiels and offer both seed and pellets. They love them all! It's so funny to see the babies with rainbow colors all around them as the parents feed and are messy. I like the parakeet size because there is MUCH less waste than with the larger cockatiel size. They will take one bit out of the larger pellets and the rest falls to the floor so is wasted. I highly recommend this food and the price is right here on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lachelt

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find pellet food for Parakeets in a much ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find pellet food for Parakeets in a much larger size than a major pet store (10lbs vs 2lbs) and more economical. Since I have several birds I go through the small store bag fairly quickly and the major pet store is a 30 minute dive away so this is much more convenient. My birds still prefer seeds, but they have warmed up to the pellets over time. Will be ordering again when needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zupreem fruitblend pellets
customer_reviews.text: Both my parakeet and cockatiel like this. However it may not be the absolute best pellet for birds. I did try a brand, Harris I think recommended by an Avian Vet - but the birds would not touch it. Since my birds seem to like and eat fruit blend that is what I offer them. There is something similar called Zupreem Avian Entrees Harvest Feast for small bird in a larger pellet size which I offer for the cockatiel - both birds will eat that also.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I mix this with some seed and the birds eat it up
customer_reviews.author: shari pfenninger

customer_reviews.title: Parakeets love it
customer_reviews.text: I mix this food with my regular parakeet food, and they really love it.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome food and awesome shipping♡♡♡
customer_reviews.text: My parakeets love this food. And I love how well they package this item. This was wrapped 3 times in bubble wrap. This is the only item I got this week from amazon that wasnt damaged ♡♡♡♡
customer_reviews.author: Sonni

customer_reviews.title: Great for small birds
customer_reviews.text: My parakeet loves her pellets! The only brand I buy her.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I Love it and my bird loves it to! His favorite food!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin South

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by the pet shop
customer_reviews.text: The pet shop recommended it and it seems fine. It will forever more be in my carpet but oh well. At least it's so small it sifts down so i can't see it..
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Birds hate this
customer_reviews.text: My birds won't eat this. Too many colors and smells and flavors, they pick out only one kind and the rest is wasted. I go with the regular kind and they eat it up.
customer_reviews.author: Becki H

customer_reviews.title: Smells like Fruity Pebbles
customer_reviews.text: My parakeets like the natural flavored ones better. But they eat this in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Shasta

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 different types of birds, all younger than 1 yr., will not even try this or the other varieties for larger birds. Waste of $, no wonder its now on sale at Pet Smart.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Great price on Zupreem Fruitblend
customer_reviews.text: The Zupreem is always fresh and my small softbills really like it. Fast shipping and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: david hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: I have been giving this to my parakeets for years. They love it and eat it down to the last morsel.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fast shipping,and my birds love the food.I like ordering these pellets,and the bag lasts for a month.Buying this bag saves me money because at the pet store it is expensive to buy bird pellets.Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie F.

customer_reviews.title: I think this is vet approved - my birds like it.
customer_reviews.text: My birds like it. If your bird is accustomed to seeds you will need to transition over to this.
customer_reviews.author: LightOwl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money and arrived with a year till expiration. Easy way to feed multiple birds and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: My cockatoo doesn't waste this smaller piece good
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo doesn't waste this smaller piece good . That's a big help! I first found out about zoopreem in 1974 working at a major zoo. They used it on their million dollar and rare animals. Good enough for my cockatoo. smells good enough for human snacks.
customer_reviews.author: doc c

customer_reviews.title: Parakeet food fast
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping which was great. The parakeets seem to love it. thank you :)
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Burrows

customer_reviews.title: All 30 of my parakeets love it as well as my cockatiel
customer_reviews.text: Presentation: item came ripped but guessing it came from UPS carelessness of packages. My birds took a while to try it but now they love this item. I’ve also seen them a bit more brighter with all the different foods including this product. Overall good bird food
customer_reviews.author: DeathByFuego

product_meta.title: ZuPreem FruitBlend Flavor Pellets Bird Food for Small Birds | Powerful Pellets Made in USA, Naturally Flavored for Parakeets, Budgies, Parrotlets
product_meta.description: Size:10 lb bagFruit blend flavor with natural flavors provides healthy and delicious nutrition for everyday Feeding for birds that prefer this pellet size. Fruit colors, shapes and flavors with the essential nutrients your bird needs every day for good health.
feature_bullets: Provides Healthy And Balanced Nutrition For Parakeets, Budgerigars, Parrotlets, And Other Small Parrots
Contains Fresh Ground Fruit And 21 Vitamins And Minerals In Every Bite
